Description: Handle zone sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of three hoplites attacking to right (from left, trace of round shield of first warrior; in centre, upper body of second warrior with added white on the crest of helmet, holding a spear in raised right arm and part of round shield with possible trace of added red on device; at right, raised right arm of third warrior and part of red rim of round shield).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 89 no. 303 pl. 67)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 422-3, no. B665, pl. XXVIII, pl. CCVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1336) (phase 3)
